intro: Caulinia serristipula, commonly known as the serrated-stipitate caulinia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves with serrated edges, which contribute to its distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typical of the family. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Caulinia serristipula is typically found in arid or semi-arid regions, where it adapts to dry conditions with its succulent leaves and deep root system.
